message: Let's start with a fair split, 60-40. I'll take the lower amount this round, but I'm hoping to negotiate a better deal later.
I'm not impressed with the 60-40 offer. Let's try a 50-50 split this round.
50-50 is too even, I'd like to keep more. Let's try 55-45 this round.
I'm willing to compromise, but I think 55-45 is a fairer split. I'm sticking to this offer.
You're not budging on the 55-45 split? I'm taking a firmer stance this round. I'll take the majority, but I'll give you a smaller share.
You're taking too much, Bob. I'm not willing to let you take 70%. I'll counter with 40-60 this round.
I'm willing to give you a slightly larger share, but I'm not budging much. This is my final offer for now.
I'm not impressed with the slight concession. I'm taking a bigger share this round, and you're getting a smaller one. It's my turn to dictate the terms.
You're taking too much, Bob. I'm not willing to let you take 80%. I'll try to squeeze out a bit more, but I'll have to be more aggressive.
I'm not giving up yet. I'll try to get as much as I can, but I'm not willing to go below 22% of the total. This is my last stand.
You're really pushing your luck, Alice. I'm taking the majority of the remaining money, and you're getting a tiny share. It's almost over.
You're taking too much, Bob. I'd rather go to the next round than accept such an unfavorable split. I'll try to squeeze out a bit more, but I'm not optimistic.
I'm running out of options. I'll try to get as much as I can, but I'm not willing to go below 11% of the total. This is my last, last stand.
